greece.name: Moussaka
greece.description: A layered oven casserole dish made with vegetables and meat.

greece.name: Souvlaki
greece.description: Grilled pieces of meat served on a skewer.

greece.name: Spanakopita
greece.description: A spinach and feta cheese pie wrapped in phyllo pastry.

greece.name: Gyros
greece.description: Meat, usually pork, chicken, or lamb, roasted vertically and served wrapped in pita bread.

greece.name: Tzatziki
greece.description: A yogurt-based sauce with cucumber and garlic.

greece.name: Dolmadakia
greece.description: Grape leaves stuffed with rice and herbs.

greece.name: Baklava
greece.description: A sweet dessert pastry made of layers of filo filled with chopped nuts and sweetened with syrup or honey.

greece.name: Fasolada
greece.description: A bean soup considered the national dish of Greece.

greece.name: Koulouri
greece.description: A sesame bread ring resembling a bagel.

italy.name: Pizza Margherita
italy.description: A simple pizza topped with tomatoes, mozzarella cheese, fresh basil, salt, and olive oil.

italy.name: Pasta Carbonara
italy.description: A pasta dish from Rome made with egg, hard cheese, cured pork, and black pepper.

italy.name: Lasagna
italy.description: A layered pasta dish made with alternating layers of pasta sheets, cheese, sauce, and meat.

italy.name: Risotto
italy.description: A creamy rice dish cooked in broth to a creamy consistency.

italy.name: Tiramisu
italy.description: A coffee-flavored Italian dessert made of ladyfingers dipped in coffee, layered with a whipped mixture of eggs, sugar, and mascarpone cheese, flavored with cocoa.

italy.name: Osso Buco
italy.description: A Lombard cuisine dish made with veal shanks cooked with vegetables, white wine, and broth.

italy.name: Caprese Salad
italy.description: A simple Italian salad made of sliced fresh mozzarella, tomatoes, and sweet basil, seasoned with salt and olive oil.

italy.name: Focaccia
italy.description: An oven-baked Italian bread product similar in style and texture to pizza doughs.

italy.name: Panzanella
italy.description: A Tuscan salad of bread and tomatoes that is popular in the summer.

japan.name: Sushi
japan.description: Vinegared rice combined with various ingredients, such as seafood, vegetables, and occasionally tropical fruits.

japan.name: Ramen
japan.description: A noodle soup dish that was originally imported from China and has become one of the most popular dishes in Japan in recent decades.

japan.name: Tempura
japan.description: Seafood or vegetables that have been battered and deep fried.

japan.name: Sashimi
japan.description: Sliced raw fish or meat served with soy sauce and wasabi.

japan.name: Okonomiyaki
japan.description: A savory version of a Japanese pancake, made with flour, eggs, shredded cabbage, meat/protein, and topped with a variety of condiments.

japan.name: Takoyaki
japan.description: A ball-shaped Japanese snack made of a wheat flour-based batter and cooked in a special molded pan, filled with minced or diced octopus, tempura scraps, pickled ginger, and green onion.

japan.name: Miso Soup
japan.description: A traditional Japanese soup consisting of a stock called 'dashi' into which softened miso paste is mixed. It often contains seaweed, tofu, and spring onions.

japan.name: Tonkatsu
japan.description: A Japanese dish that consists of a breaded, deep-fried pork cutlet.

japan.name: Unagi
japan.description: A dish of grilled eel, usually served over rice.

japan.name: Kaiseki
japan.description: A traditional multi-course Japanese dinner. The term also refers to the collection of skills and techniques that allow the preparation of such meals, and is analogous to Western haute cuisine.

thailand.name: Pad Thai
thailand.description: A stir-fried rice noodle dish commonly served as a street food and at casual local eateries in Thailand.

thailand.name: Tom Yum Goong
thailand.description: A hot and sour Thai soup usually cooked with shrimp.

thailand.name: Som Tam
thailand.description: A spicy salad made from shredded unripe papaya.

thailand.name: Massaman Curry
thailand.description: A rich, relatively mild Thai curry that is an interpretation of a Persian dish.

thailand.name: Green Curry
thailand.description: Made with green chilies and flavored with a variety of aromatic herbs including lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, and galangal.

thailand.name: Red Curry
thailand.description: Made with red chilies and is slightly more spicy and aromatic than Green Curry.

thailand.name: Khao Pad
thailand.description: Thai fried rice, typically with chicken, crab or shrimp, eggs, onions, and sometimes tomatoes.

thailand.name: Pad Krapow Moo Saap
thailand.description: Fried basil and pork - a popular street food dish.

thailand.name: Mango Sticky Rice
thailand.description: A traditional Thai dessert made with glutinous rice, fresh mango, and coconut milk.

turkey.name: Kebab
turkey.description: A broad variety of meat dishes originating in Turkish cuisine, kebabs can be grilled, roasted, or stewed meat dishes, often served on skewers.

turkey.name: Baklava
turkey.description: A rich, sweet pastry made of layers of filo filled with chopped nuts, sweetened with syrup or honey.

turkey.name: Meze
turkey.description: A selection of small dishes served as appetizers or accompaniments to alcoholic drinks.

turkey.name: Döner
turkey.description: Meat cooked on a vertical rotisserie, traditionally lamb but now also chicken or beef, served in bread as a sandwich or wrapped in a flatbread.

turkey.name: Lahmacun
turkey.description: A round, thin piece of dough topped with minced meat (most commonly beef or lamb), vegetables, and herbs including onions, tomatoes, and parsley, then baked.

turkey.name: Menemen
turkey.description: A traditional Turkish dish which includes egg, onion, tomato, green peppers, and spices such as ground black pepper, ground red pepper, salt, and oregano.

turkey.name: Simit
turkey.description: A circular bread, typically encrusted with sesame seeds or, less commonly, poppy, sunflower, flax, or pumpkin seeds, served plain or with preserves, cheese, or olives.

turkey.name: Börek
turkey.description: A family of baked or fried filled pastries made of a thin flaky dough known as phyllo (or yufka), filled with cheese, minced meat, or vegetables.

turkey.name: İskender Kebab
turkey.description: Thinly sliced lamb basted with hot tomato sauce over pieces of pita bread and generously slathered with melted sheep butter and yogurt. Tomato sauce and melted butter are generally poured over the dish, at the table.

turkey.name: Manti
turkey.description: Turkish dumplings filled with a spiced meat mixture, usually lamb or beef, and served with a yogurt sauce.

poland.name: Pierogi
poland.description: Dumplings filled with a variety of ingredients, such as potatoes, cheese, meat, or fruits, often served with onions or sour cream.

poland.name: Bigos
poland.description: A hearty stew of chopped meat of various kinds, sauerkraut, and shredded fresh cabbage, known as 'Hunter's stew'.

poland.name: Żurek
poland.description: A sour rye soup with sausages, often served in a bread bowl.

poland.name: Kotlet Schabowy
poland.description: A Polish variety of pork breaded cutlet coated with breadcrumbs similar to Wiener Schnitzel, but made of loin with the bone or without.

poland.name: Placki Ziemniaczane
poland.description: Potato pancakes, often served with a dollop of sour cream or apple sauce.

poland.name: Barszcz
poland.description: A beet soup, often served with sour cream or a dollop of cream; can be served clear or with other ingredients.

poland.name: Gołąbki
poland.description: Cabbage rolls stuffed with spiced minced meat and rice or with mushrooms and rice, served with a tomato or mushroom sauce.

poland.name: Kielbasa
poland.description: Polish sausage, comes in dozens of varieties, smoked or fresh.

poland.name: Kaszanka
poland.description: Polish blood sausage, made of a mixture of blood, pork offal, and buckwheat or barley, seasoned with onion, pepper, and marjoram.

poland.name: Naleśniki
poland.description: Polish pancakes, thin and filled with sweet or savory fillings, such as cheese, fruits, or meat.

germany.name: Bratwurst
germany.description: A type of German sausage made from pork, beef, or veal.

germany.name: Sauerkraut
germany.description: Finely cut raw cabbage that has been fermented by various lactic acid bacteria.

germany.name: Pretzel
germany.description: A type of baked bread product made from dough most commonly shaped into a twisted knot.

germany.name: Schnitzel
germany.description: Meat, thinned by pounding with a meat tenderizer, coated with flour, beaten eggs and bread crumbs, and then fried.

germany.name: Sauerbraten
germany.description: A pot roast, usually of beef (but other meats such as lamb, mutton, pork, and traditionally, horse), marinated before slow cooking as pot roast.

germany.name: Spätzle
germany.description: A type of pasta made with fresh eggs, typically served as a side dish with meat, but also eaten alone or with sauces.

germany.name: Kartoffelsalat
germany.description: German potato salad, typically made with potatoes, vinegar, oil, and onions.

germany.name: Rouladen
germany.description: A dish consisting of bacon, onions, mustard, and pickles wrapped in thinly sliced beef which is then cooked.

germany.name: Apfelstrudel
germany.description: An apple strudel, a traditional Viennese strudel, a popular pastry in Austria and in many countries in Europe that once belonged to the Austro-Hungarian empire.

germany.name: Black Forest Cake
germany.description: A chocolate sponge cake with a rich cherry filling based on the German dessert Schwarzwälder Kirschtorte, literally 'Black Forest cherry-torte'.

india.name: Biryani
india.description: A mixed rice dish with spices, rice, and meat (chicken, beef, goat, pork, lamb, prawn, or fish) or vegetables.

india.name: Butter Chicken
india.description: A dish of chicken in a mildly spiced tomato sauce, served with rice or bread.

india.name: Chole Bhature
india.description: A combination of chana masala (spicy white chickpeas) and fried bread called bhature (made of maida flour).

india.name: Dosa
india.description: A fermented crepe made from rice batter and black lentils, served with a variety of chutneys and sambar.

india.name: Palak Paneer
india.description: A vegetarian dish consisting of paneer (a type of cottage cheese) in a thick paste made from puréed spinach and seasoned with garlic, garam masala, and other spices.

india.name: Rogan Josh
india.description: A type of curry made with tender meat, typically lamb or goat, and a sauce flavored with garlic, ginger, and aromatic spices.

india.name: Samosa
india.description: A fried or baked pastry with a savory filling, such as spiced potatoes, onions, peas, or lentils.

india.name: Tandoori Chicken
india.description: Chicken marinated in yogurt and spices and then roasted in a tandoor, a cylindrical clay oven.

india.name: Naan
india.description: A leavened, oven-baked flatbread found in the cuisines of Central and South Asia.

india.name: Gulab Jamun
india.description: A sweet dessert consisting of deep-fried balls of dough made from milk solids, soaked in a syrup of sugar, rose water, and cardamom.

mexico.name: Tacos
mexico.description: Corn or wheat tortilla folded or rolled around a filling such as beef, pork, chicken, seafood, vegetables, and cheese.

mexico.name: Enchiladas
mexico.description: Corn tortillas rolled around a filling and covered with a chili pepper sauce, often served with a side of rice and beans.

mexico.name: Guacamole
mexico.description: An avocado-based dip, spread, or salad first developed by the Aztecs in what is now Mexico.

mexico.name: Quesadillas
mexico.description: A tortilla, usually a flour tortilla but also sometimes made with a corn tortilla, filled with cheese and sometimes meats, spices or other fillings, and then cooked on a griddle.

mexico.name: Chiles en nogada
mexico.description: Poblano chiles stuffed with picadillo (a mixture usually containing shredded meat, aromatics, fruits and spices) topped with a walnut-based cream sauce, called nogada, and pomegranate seeds, giving it the three colors of the Mexican flag.

mexico.name: Tamales
mexico.description: Masa (corn dough) steamed in a corn husk or banana leaf, filled with meats, cheeses, fruits, vegetables, chilies or any preparation according to taste, and both the filling and the cooking liquid may be seasoned.

mexico.name: Pozole
mexico.description: A traditional soup or stew from Mexican cuisine, made from hominy, with meat (typically pork), and seasoned and garnished with shredded lettuce or cabbage, chile peppers, onion, garlic, radishes, avocado, salsa or limes.

mexico.name: Mole
mexico.description: A traditional sauce originally used in Mexican cuisine, as well as for dishes based on these sauces. The sauces are complex and are made from a variety of ingredients including chili peppers, spices, chocolate, and fruit.

mexico.name: Ceviche
mexico.description: A seafood dish typically made from fresh raw fish cured in fresh citrus juices, most commonly lemon or lime, and spiced with ají, chili peppers or other seasonings including chopped onions, salt, and cilantro.

mexico.name: Carnitas
mexico.description: Mexican version of pulled pork, traditionally made by braising or simmering pork in oil or preferably lard until tender.

portugal.name: Bacalhau
portugal.description: Codfish that has been salted and dried, often served with potatoes and onions.

portugal.name: Francesinha
portugal.description: A Portuguese sandwich originally from Porto, made with bread, wet-cured ham, linguiça, fresh sausage like chipolata, steak or roast meat, and covered with melted cheese and a hot thick tomato and beer sauce.

portugal.name: Pastéis de Nata
portugal.description: A Portuguese egg tart pastry, originally from Lisbon.

portugal.name: Caldo Verde
portugal.description: A traditional Portuguese soup made with kale, potatoes, and sausage.

portugal.name: Cozido à Portuguesa
portugal.description: A traditional Portuguese stew typically made with a variety of meats, sausages, and vegetables.

portugal.name: Feijoada
portugal.description: A stew of beans with beef and pork, which is a typical Portuguese dish.

portugal.name: Arroz de Marisco
portugal.description: A seafood rice dish, often considered a Portuguese version of paella.

portugal.name: Alheira
portugal.description: A type of Portuguese sausage made from meats other than pork (traditionally game meats, poultry, and bread).

portugal.name: Sardinhas Assadas
portugal.description: Grilled sardines, a very popular dish especially in the summer during the traditional Saint Anthony's festivals.

portugal.name: Bifanas
portugal.description: Portuguese pork cutlet sandwiches, typically seasoned with garlic and spices, served in a Portuguese roll.

china.name: Peking Duck
china.description: A famous dish from Beijing, enjoying world fame, and considered as one of China’s national dishes.

china.name: Dim Sum
china.description: A style of Chinese cuisine prepared as small bite-sized portions of food served in small steamer baskets or on small plates.

china.name: Hot Pot
china.description: A Chinese cooking method, prepared with a simmering pot of soup stock at the dining table, containing a variety of East Asian foodstuffs and ingredients.

china.name: Kung Pao Chicken
china.description: A spicy, stir-fried Chinese dish made with cubes of chicken, peanuts, vegetables, and chili peppers.

china.name: Mapo Tofu
china.description: A popular Chinese dish from Sichuan province. It consists of tofu set in a spicy sauce, typically a thin, oily, and bright red suspension, based on doubanjiang (bean paste) and douchi (fermented black beans), along with minced meat, traditionally beef.

china.name: Dumplings
china.description: A broad class of dishes that consist of pieces of dough (made from a variety of starch sources) wrapped around a filling, or of dough with no filling. The dough can be bread, flour, or potatoes, and the filling can be meat, vegetables, or sweets.

china.name: Chow Mein
china.description: A Chinese dish of stir-fried noodles with vegetables and sometimes meat or tofu; the name is a romanization of the Taishanese chāu-mèing.

china.name: Spring Rolls
china.description: A large variety of filled, rolled appetizers or dim sum found in East Asian and Southeast Asian cuisine.

china.name: Sweet and Sour Pork
china.description: The dish consists of deep fried pork in bite-sized pieces, and subsequently stir-fried in a more customized version of sweet and sour sauce made out of sugar, ketchup, white vinegar, and soy sauce.

china.name: Wonton Soup
china.description: A Cantonese comfort food consisting of broth filled with dumplings made with wrappers and filled with pork and shrimp.

indonesia.name: Peking Duck
indonesia.description: A famous dish from Beijing, enjoying world fame, and considered as one of China’s national dishes.

indonesia.name: Dim Sum
indonesia.description: A style of Chinese cuisine prepared as small bite-sized portions of food served in small steamer baskets or on small plates.

indonesia.name: Hot Pot
indonesia.description: A Chinese cooking method, prepared with a simmering pot of soup stock at the dining table, containing a variety of East Asian foodstuffs and ingredients.

indonesia.name: Kung Pao Chicken
indonesia.description: A spicy, stir-fried Chinese dish made with cubes of chicken, peanuts, vegetables, and chili peppers.

indonesia.name: Mapo Tofu
indonesia.description: A popular Chinese dish from Sichuan province. It consists of tofu set in a spicy sauce, typically a thin, oily, and bright red suspension, based on doubanjiang (bean paste) and douchi (fermented black beans), along with minced meat, traditionally beef.

indonesia.name: Dumplings
indonesia.description: A broad class of dishes that consist of pieces of dough (made from a variety of starch sources) wrapped around a filling, or of dough with no filling. The dough can be bread, flour, or potatoes, and the filling can be meat, vegetables, or sweets.

indonesia.name: Chow Mein
indonesia.description: A Chinese dish of stir-fried noodles with vegetables and sometimes meat or tofu; the name is a romanization of the Taishanese chāu-mèing.

indonesia.name: Spring Rolls
indonesia.description: A large variety of filled, rolled appetizers or dim sum found in East Asian and Southeast Asian cuisine.

indonesia.name: Sweet and Sour Pork
indonesia.description: The dish consists of deep fried pork in bite-sized pieces, and subsequently stir-fried in a more customized version of sweet and sour sauce made out of sugar, ketchup, white vinegar, and soy sauce.

indonesia.name: Wonton Soup
indonesia.description: A Cantonese comfort food consisting of broth filled with dumplings made with wrappers and filled with pork and shrimp.

france.name: Coq au Vin
france.description: Chicken braised with wine, lardons, mushrooms, and optionally garlic.

france.name: Bouillabaisse
france.description: A traditional Provençal fish stew originating from the port city of Marseille.

france.name: Ratatouille
france.description: A stewed vegetable dish originating from Nice, consisting of zucchini, eggplant, bell peppers, onion, tomato, and seasoned with herbs.

france.name: Quiche Lorraine
france.description: A savoury pie from the Lorraine region made with eggs, cream, and bacon.

france.name: Escargot
france.description: Snails cooked with garlic butter, chicken stock, or wine.

france.name: Foie Gras
france.description: A delicacy made from the liver of a duck or goose that has been specially fattened.

france.name: Tarte Tatin
france.description: An upside-down pastry in which the fruit (usually apples) are caramelized in butter and sugar before the tart is baked.

france.name: Croissant
france.description: A buttery, flaky, viennoiserie pastry of Austrian origin, named for its historical crescent shape.

france.name: Crème Brûlée
france.description: A dessert consisting of a rich custard base topped with a contrasting layer of hard caramel.

france.name: Soupe à l’Oignon
france.description: French onion soup made with beef broth and caramelized onions, often served gratinéed with cheese on top of a large piece of bread.
